paragraphs.content: Chapter 13
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 13

paragraphs.content: Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.

paragraphs.content: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.

paragraphs.content: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.

paragraphs.content: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.

paragraphs.content: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.

paragraphs.content: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.

paragraphs.content: Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?

paragraphs.content: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?

paragraphs.content: Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?

paragraphs.content: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.

paragraphs.content: Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?

paragraphs.content: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.

paragraphs.content: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?

paragraphs.content: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.

paragraphs.content: He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.

paragraphs.content: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.

paragraphs.content: Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.

paragraphs.content: Who is he that will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who is he that will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.

paragraphs.content: Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.

paragraphs.content: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.

paragraphs.content: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.

paragraphs.content: How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?

paragraphs.content: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?

paragraphs.content: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.

paragraphs.content: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.

paragraphs.content: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.
